properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Advisory issued January 9 at 2:00AM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, minor lakeshore
flooding expected along Lake St Clair. For the Lakeshore Flood
Watch, significant lakeshore flooding possible along Lake Huron.

* WHERE...St. Clair County.

* WHEN...For the Lakeshore Flood Advisory, from 8 AM this
morning to 11 AM EST Friday. For the Lakeshore Flood Watch,
from Saturday morning through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Low lying property including homes, businesses, and
some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline
erosion may occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds of 15 to 25 MPH this
morning will turn to the south this afternoon and perist into
tonight. These gusty southerly winds and the high lake levels
will cause flooding along Anchor Bay and Harsens Island. More
significant flooding is possible along the Lake Huron shoreline
of the county Saturday and Saturday night as north to northeast
gales are forecast on Lake Huron.
properties.instruction:
Residents on or near the shore should take appropriate action to
protect property from rising water levels.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 AM EST FRIDAY... ...LAKESHORE FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
